text: The 2019 PSL All-Filipino Conference is the fifth conference and second indoor tournament for the Philippine Super Liga's seventh season. The games began on June 15, 2019 at the Filoil Flying V Centre, San Juan and will end as soon as there is a winner. ==Teams== {| class="wikitable" style="width:100%; text- align:left" |- ! style=background:#ff3300 colspan=7 | 2019 PSL All Filipino Conference teams |- ! style="background:white" | Abbr. ! style="background:white" | Team ! style="background:white" | Company ! style="background:white" | Colors ! style="background:white" | Head Coach ! style="background:white" | Team Captain |- | align=center | CHD | align=center | Cignal HD Spikers | align=center | Cignal TV, Inc. | align=center | | align=center | Edgar Barroga | align=center | Rachel Anne Daquis |- | align=center | FTL | align=center | F2 Logistics Cargo Movers | align=center | F2 Global Logistics Inc. | align=center | | align=center | Ramil de Jesus | align=center | Abigail Maraño |- | align=center | FOT | align=center | Foton Tornadoes Blue Energy | align=center | United Asia Automotive Group, Inc. | align=center | | align=center | Aaron Velez | align=center | Carmina Aganon |- | align=center | GAL | align=center | Generika-Ayala Lifesavers | align=center | Actimed, Inc. | align=center | | align=center | Sherwin Meneses | align=center | Angeli Pauline Araneta |- | align=center | MPS | align=center | Marinerang Pilipina Lady Skippers | align=center | | align=center | | align=center | Ronald Dulay | align=center | Ivy Remulla |- | align=center | PET | align=center | Petron Blaze Spikers | align=center | Petron Corporation | align=center | | align=center | Cesael delos Santos | align=center | Frances Xinia Molina |- | align=center | PHF | align=center | PLDT Home Fibr Power Hitters | align=center | PLDT | align=center | | align=center | Roger Gorayeb | align=center | Jerrili Malabanan |- | align=center | SLR | align=center | Sta. Velez Sports & Cultural Center - Silay City * Ynares Center - Antipolo * Caloocan Sports Complex - Caloocan City * Quezon Convention Center - Lucena City * Malolos Sports & Convention Center - Malolos City * Imus Sports Center * Corpus Christi Gymnasium - Cagayan de Oro City ==Broadcast Partners== *ESPN 5: 5 Plus, One Sports (SD and HD), ESPN5.com, ESPN Player (Online) ==References== Category:Philippine Super Liga Category:Volleyball competitions in the Philippines PSL
